text: В итоге мэрия предложила лидеру незарегистрированной Национал-демократической партии (НДП) Владимиру Кралину провести марш в Люблино и взять на себя роль организатора шествия. Кралин, который изначально подавал заявку на шествие по другому маршруту, от предложения отказываться не стал.В этом году, говорит Демушкин, ситуация повторяется: «На меня вышли сотрудники ФСБ и сказали мне, что в этом году никакого «Русского марша» проводить не надо, что не надо нам высовываться. Но мы все будем делать по закону — подадим заявку и будем ждать официального ответа мэрии».

El FC Barcelona ha anunciado este martes que el delantero francés Ousmane Dembélé fue operado con éxito de su muslo derecho, pero pasará los próximos seis meses sin jugar.La baja de Dembélé le permitirá al club catalán contratar a otro jugador en su reemplazo, ya que supera el tiempo mínimo de recuperación exigido por reglamento.

September 11 brings vivid memories of the 2001 terrorist attack on the Pentagon for Bruce Powers. The George Washington University professor was a Pentagon defense analyst at the time, and was on the job that fateful day.

В Украине предстоят президентские выборы, и по предварительным оценкам, к ним приедут более 850 международных наблюдателей. На выборы приедут наблюдатели из правительственных и некоммерческих организаций по всему миру, а также члены различных международных организаций.

American documentary filmmaker and activist Chris Flaherty is on a hunger strike in support of jailed opposition leader Birtukan Midekssa.Birtukan, leader of the largest opposition group in Ethiopia, UDJ, has been held at the Kality prison for the past 16 months on alleged treason charges.Flaherty, became interested in Birtukan's case while doing research for his film about Ethiopian politics and election 2005. He says he became convinced that the Ethiopian government claims about her are inaccurate. He is using his strike to bring her case to the attention of the Obama administration. He is calling on them to name her a prisoner of conscious."This is important to me as she was jailed simply because she stands by what she believes. To me that is a strong character. She believes in the same values that I believe in as far as democracy and freedom are concerned. I would hunger-strike for any one like that," Chris asserts. "She shouldn't have been in jail in the first place."Kebadu Belachew, an Ethiopian-American took three days off from work to join Chris on the hunger strike in front of the White House.Birtukan was arrested in December 2008 for allegedly violating the terms of an earlier pardon.

An uneasy cease-fire took hold in Syria Thursday between government forces and rebel militias, But there is widespread skepticism that it will last.As the world waits to see if envoy Kofi Annan's brokered cease-fire will hold, Syrian opposition activists say while they support his efforts, they do not believe the plan will ultimately succeed. "We wanted to give them a little time despite the fact that so many people are dying on the ground and in the streets that it is necessary to give the international community some time to find out if diplomacy is not going to work," explained Syrian activist Ammar Abdulhamid.The government of Bashar al-Assad says it will honor the cease-fire with conditions: it reserves the right to defend itself against what it says are the terrorists behind the uprising. If the fighting does resume, many are asking what next? Russia and China have blocked action by the United Nation Security Council. The Obama administration has offered humanitarian assistance and communications equipment. But while visiting a refugee camp in Turkey this week, U.S. Senators John McCain and Joe Lieberman said the Annan plan is failing, and called for arming the opposition. "The only way to reverse this situation is by helping the Syrian opposition to change the military balance of power on the ground," said McCain.Some in the opposition say that neither diplomacy nor military force alone will bring down the Assad government. Ammar Abdulhamid says they must be used together. "When there is an actual threat of force or force being used, I think then we might see the possibility of the Assads listening because they can see a threat," Abdulhamid added. "They can see the seriousness of the international community.

РИГА, 26 марта. /Корр. ТАСС Евгений Антонов/. Послы России в Латвии, Литве и Эстонии вызваны в понедельник в МИД этих балтийских республик. Об этом сообщили корреспонденту ТАСС дипломатические источники.Как сообщили ТАСС в посольстве России в Латвии, посол России Евгений Лукьянов вызван в МИД в 15:00 по времени Риги (совпадает с мск). Позднее в понедельник посол проведет пресс-конференцию.Российский посол в Эстонии Александр Петров вызван в МИД страны в 15:00 по времени Таллина (также совпадает с мск), сообщили источники корреспонденту ТАСС в посольстве РФ в этой республике. В МИД Эстонии эту информацию комментировать отказались.

GENEVA - The U.N. refugee agency reports it is stepping up efforts to reduce the risk of the spread of the deadly Ebola virus as refugees flee DR Congo. Latest estimates put the number of confirmed and probable cases of Ebola in eastern DRC at 49, including 38 deaths.The U.N. refugee agency is working closely with DRC authorities and other agencies on actions to contain Ebola on the national and regional level. But, its main focus is to monitor possible Ebola infections among refugees fleeing across the border, mainly to Uganda, from conflict ridden North Kivu and Ituri.UNHCR spokesman, William Spindler says the number of newly arriving refugees into Uganda from these two Ebola affected provinces increased during July from 170 a day to 250 a day. He says the majority currently is crossing at the Kisoro border point.“So UNHCR is working with WHO, UNICEF and other partners and with the Ministry of Health of Uganda to intensify screening for Ebola at all border entry points. And, additional health workers have been deployed in the border districts to improve response capacity,” he said.Spindler notes the World Health Organization is not recommending any restriction on the movement of people.

Berlin - Der ägyptisch-deutsche Autor und Islamkritiker Hamed Abdel-Samad warnt vor dem politischen Islam in Deutschland. In einem Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag" sagte er, dass die politischen Islamisten versuchen würden, die Macht in Deutschland zu übernehmen.Abdel-Samad, der selbst muslimischer Herkunft ist, betonte, dass es wichtig sei, den Unterschied zwischen dem Islam als Religion und dem politischen Islam als Ideologie zu verstehen. Er warnte davor, dass der politische Islam die Freiheit und Demokratie in Deutschland gefährden könne.Der Autor forderte, dass die Politik und die Gesellschaft in Deutschland wachsamer sein müssten und den politischen Islam nicht unterschätzen dürften. Er warnte auch davor, dass der politische Islam versuche, Muslime in Deutschland zu spalten und gegen die Gesellschaft aufzuhetzen.Abdel-Samad ist bekannt für seine kritischen Äußerungen zum Islam und hat bereits mehrere Bücher zu diesem Thema veröffentlicht. Er selbst lebt wegen seiner kritischen Haltung unter Polizeischutz.

U.S. President-elect Barack Obama is expected to soon name his choice for Treasury secretary, about 10 weeks before he takes office and inherits the country's worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.Aides say Mr. Obama plans to meet Friday with his economic team and hold his first news conference since winning the election.Mr. Obama was being briefed Thursday on highly classified intelligence. The White House says President George Bush will meet with Mr. Obama on Monday in Washington to discuss the transfer of power.Mr. Obama's choice for chief of staff, Rahm Emanuel, accepted the job Thursday. Emanuel is an Illinois congressman who also served under former President Bill Clinton.In a statement, Obama called Emanuel a "good friend" said he knows no one better at "getting things done." Emanuel said he will do everything he can to help the President-elect unite Americans and deliver the change the country needs.Sources close to Mr.

LONDON - “I hope I die before I get old,” The Who sang in their 1965 hit “My Generation.”But more than 50 years on, the veteran rock band’s two surviving original members are set for a new tour named “Moving On!” and the release of their first album of new music in 13 years.Singer Roger Daltrey and guitarist/songwriter Pete Townshend, now in their 70s, will take the stage in May as part of The Who’s current six-member lineup and backed by an orchestra to play venues in the United States and Canada as well as London’s Wembley Stadium in July.After tours of past hits, namely the hugely influential rock operas “Tommy” and “Quadrophenia,” Daltrey, who performed with an orchestra last year, said it was time to do something “that reflects where we are in our lives at the moment.”Music that feels ‘kind of grown up’“We’re old men now ... we can’t go out there and pretend it’s going to be anywhere like we were 40, 50 years ago,” he told Reuters in an interview at Wembley.“Adding the orchestra ... can elevate the music into a place where it feels kind of grown up ... (but) people mustn’t think just because there’s an orchestra with The Who that it’s going to be watered down. We’ll be playing exactly full throttle like we usually do.”

El grupo inmobiliario Tremón anunció hoy que también presentará un concurso voluntario de acreedores. Esta medida tendrá por objeto renegociar los pasivos financieros y económicos de la empresa, con el fin de evitar la declaración de insolvencia.El concurso voluntario de acreedores está dirigido a todos aquellos acreedores no garantizados. La empresa espera obtener un acuerdo amistoso con los acreedores para reducir sus pasivos.El concurso de acreedores está regulado por el Código de Comercio y su inicio tendrá lugar el 15 de agosto. Durante el período de concurso, la empresa no podrá efectuar nuevos pagos a sus acreedores, excepto aquellos que estén relacionados con el acuerdo de renegociación.Tremón espera contar con el apoyo de sus acreedores para encontrar una solución amigable y satisfactoria para todas las partes.

المصدر: بغداد - من أحمد الساعديحذر المرجع الديني علي السيستاني، الخميس، وزير الخارجية العراقي إبراهيم الجعفري من الإفراج عن معتقلين قطريين متهمين بالإرهاب تم أسرهم من قبل كتائب حزب الله العراقي، الثلاثاء، في مدينة الرمادي.جاء ذلك التحذير عبر ممثل السيستاني الشيخ قاسم الأسدي الذي شدد على ضرورة عدم التهاون فيما يتعلق بتآمر وتلاعب الآخرين بأرواح العراقيين.

В среду, 25 августа, Верховная Рада внесла изменения в Налоговый и Бюджетный кодексы. Эти изменения направлены на повышение налоговых поступлений в бюджет, а также на оптимизацию расходования бюджетных средств.Одним из главных изменений является увеличение ставки НДС с 20% до 21%. Кроме того, были установлены новые правила налогообложения для интернет-торговли и услуг такси. Эти изменения позволят увеличить налоговые поступления в бюджет на сумму около 100 миллиардов гривен.Кроме изменений в налоговой сфере, были внесены изменения в Бюджетный кодекс. Одним из основных изменений является увеличение расходов на образование и здравоохранение. В частности, было увеличено финансирование науки и медицины на 10% и 5% соответственно.Парламент также утвердил новые правила распределения бюджетных средств между различными регионами Украины.

President Barack Obama will meet with the Vietnamese people today at the National Convention Center in Hanoi.“Today, we are no longer enemies, we are comrades in arms, standing together to address common challenges to the security and well-being of our people, from climate change to maritime security, and to a peaceful resolution of disputes in the region, including in the South China Sea,” said President Obama. “Today, as a former foe and a proud new member of the Asia Pacific community, you can play a central role in this effort.”The President will participate in the Young Southeast Asian Leadership Initiative (YSEALI) Town Hall. The YSEALI is the President’s signature program to strengthen leadership development and networking in Southeast Asia. This event is meant to highlight the U.S. commitment to Asia, especially to its growing youth population.President Obama also will address Vietnamese Civil Society at the town hall. The President’s participation in these events are part of a “comprehensive strategy to deepen our multi-faceted relationship” with Vietnam.The United States and Vietnam share many common challenges, including climate change, maritime security, and peaceful resolution of regional disputes, including in the South China Sea. During his trip, President Obama will explore ways to deepen our growing strategic and economic relationship and further U.S. engagement with people of Vietnam.The president will also travel to Ho Chi Minh City and is scheduled to meet with leaders from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and the East Asia Summit.President Obama will be the third American President to visit Vietnam.Tagged as: President Obama, VietnamNASA’s New Horizons: Pluto Has Blue Sky and Water IceI have 2 words for Vietnam.

В результате слияния возникла International Airlines Group, крупнейшая авиакомпания Европы.17 июля 2013 года авиакомпания British Airways получила 18-й Boeing 787 Dreamliner, тем самым завершив 6-летний процесс разворачивания программы обновления самолётов. На тот момент в British Airways было 24 самолёта B787, 85 самолётов Airbus и 73 самолёта Boeing. Последнее приобретение BA787 с заводским номером 60028, получил номер G-ZBJL и был назван «Dreamflight» в честь благотворительной организации, направленной на помощь детям с ограниченными возможностями.В 2016 году British Airways открыла регулярный маршрут в Тель-Авив, который работает 4 раза в неделю.В ноябре 2017 года британская авиакомпания British Airways заявила о начале переговоров с американской авиакомпанией American Airlines в рамках создания глобального альянса.

CINCINNATI, OHIO - It is what every aspiring baseball player strives for: a Major League appearance.“This is what you’ve been working hard for all the years,” 27-year-old South African Gift Ngoepe said. “This is what you dreamed of since you were a little kid.”Ngoepe’s dream came true April 26 with the Pittsburgh Pirates.At the top of the fourth inning at PNC Park, Ngoepe got the call to take the field, playing second base. He had just been added to the Pirates roster, promoted from their minor league affiliate Indianapolis Indians.Watch: First Players from Africa, Lithuania Mark New Era for Major League BaseballSorry, but your browser cannot support embedded video of this type, you can download this video to view it offline.“My heartbeat was very hard,” he said in an interview with VOA.Game day footage shows teammates Josh Harrison and Francisco Cervelli placing their hands over his heart as he took his position on the field.“And I felt like it was beating a little bit out of my chest,” he said.Ngoepe said the intensity increased at the bottom of the inning when he was the leadoff hitter facing All-Star pitcher John Lester of the Chicago Cubs.But Ngoepe did more than just step up to the plate.With a 3-1 count (three balls, one strike), his bat connected with the ball, driving it into the outfield for a single. With a recorded hit for his first at-bat, Ngoepe entered the history books as the first Major League Baseball player from the African continent.“It feels great to be a part of history with the Pirates,” Ngoepe said, reflecting on another moment in his remarkable journey in a sport he was born into.

A plane from Dubai was briefly quarantined at New York’s John F. Kennedy Airport after reports that a mysterious illness affected several passengers.The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention quarantined the double-decker Emirates aircraft holding 520 passengers so it could evaluate about 100 of them. Some had complained about coughs, headaches, sore throats and fevers.Officials said three passengers and seven crew members were hospitalized.

L'artista australiana Jodi Magi es va veure en una presó als EAU després d'haver publicat a Facebook una imatge d'un cotxe que bloquejava dos aparcaments per a minusvàlids a prop del seu apartament a Abu Dhabi.Tot i haver esborrat la matrícula del vehicle, l'artista de 39 anys va ser declarada culpable “d'escriure males paraules sobre una persona als mitjans socials”, va ser empresonada i, més tard deportada, segons l’Australian Broadcasting Corporation.Magi va ser arrestada quan va anar a pagar una multa i no la van alliberar fins després d'haver passat 53 hores a la presó. A la seva pàgina de Facebook descriu la seva traumàtica experiència dient:After 53 hours in custody, having been shackled at the ankles, strip-searched, blood tested, forced to sleep on a concrete floor without a mattress or pillow and having no access to toilet paper or eating utensils, I can happily say I AM SAFE & OUT OF JAIL AND ABU DHABI!

An Iranian Kurdish journalist who has been summoned for questioning by Iran's security and judicial authorities twice this year says he has been ordered to face a third round of questioning in the coming days.In a message posted on Twitter, journalist and civil rights activist Ejlal Ghavami said he received a summons from a judiciary office in the northwestern city of Sanandaj on Tuesday morning local time. Ghavami said the document, a photograph of which he attached to his tweet, called for him to appear before prosecutors of Iran's Kurdistan province within five days. It was not clear why he was being summoned.In his tweet, Ghavami said the summons represented a new case against him. He said he still faces a November court appearance in relation to an earlier case involving his journalistic and civil rights activities.In a report published Tuesday, the Iran-based Human Rights Activist News Agency (HRANA) said Ghavami had been summoned for questioning by Iranian authorities twice before in recent months.HRANA said Ghavami and two other activists in Kurdistan province were called to an intelligence office of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps in June for unknown reasons. It said that a few months earlier, Ghavami also appeared at a provincial judiciary office where cyber police questioned him about ties to anti-government protests that swept Iran in January, and to anti-government channels on the messaging app Telegram.HRANA said Kurdistan provincial prosecutors charged Ghavami on March 25 with publishing false information and cooperating with anti-government Telegram channels.

ÚOHS použil absolutní výklad, uvedl soud. V případě pochybností, které vyplývají z nejasného zákona, je ale podle něj nutné zvolit výklad mírnější. Nově tedy úřad musí posoudit vztahy Kauflandu k jednotlivým dodavatelům a nebude moci konstatovat, že byl zákon porušen plošně. Soud ví, že tento způsob posouzení případu bude náročnější. "Nicméně náročnost spočívající v analýze každého jednotlivého odběratelsko-dodavatelského vztahu nemůže být důvodem k odmítnutí této výkladově mírnější, šetrnější varianty vůči žalobci (Kauflandu)," uvedl soud.Podle Jitky Linhartové z advokátní kanceláře Schoenherr je rozhodnutí soudu poměrně zásadní. ÚOHS bude muset nově prokazovat porušení zákona v jednotlivých vztazích s konkrétními firmami a podle toho počítat i případnou sankci.

La policía de Río de Janeiro investiga la muerte de un niño de diez años y otros tres adultos durante un operativo realizado ayer jueves (02.04.2015) en las favelas del Complexo do Alemão, al norte de la ciudad. Ante las protestas vecinales desatadas hoy, la Policía Militar ha empleado gas lacrimógeno, en un ambiente de creciente tensión.Las armas de los agentes que participaron en la redada han sido requisadas para determinar si provocaron las muertes. El gobernador de la ciudad, Luiz Fernando Pezão, lamentó las pérdidas humanas, pero reivindicó la necesidad de presencia policial en el lugar, durante décadas escondite de narcotraficantes.Con unos 70.000 habitantes, el suburbio vivió en 2010 una importante operación para arrebatárselo al control de las bandas, tras lo que se instalaron varias unidades policiales allí.

El Fogasa ha reducido un 10,8% los expedientes pendientes de tramitar a finales de 2014 en Navarra. Según datos del departamento de Economía y Empresa del Gobierno de Navarra, el Fogasa ha ido reduciendo los expedientes pendientes de tramitar en los últimos años, aunque todavía quedan muchas tareas pendientes de ser atendidas.Los datos muestran que el Fogasa ha ido reduciendo los expedientes pendientes de tramitar en los últimos años, aunque todavía quedan muchas tareas pendientes de ser atendidas. La entidad ha destacado la importancia de seguir trabajando en la mejora de los servicios, para que los ciudadanos puedan tener acceso a ellos de forma más eficiente.Los ciudadanos de Navarra han destacado la importancia de que se mantenga la misma dinámica en la mejora de los servicios, para que puedan tener acceso a ellos de forma más rápida y eficiente. También se ha destacado la importancia de seguir trabajando en la mejora de los servicios, para que los ciudadanos puedan tener acceso a ellos de forma más eficiente.En resumen, el Fogasa ha reducido un 10,8% los expedientes pendientes de tramitar a finales de 2014 en Navarra, aunque todavía hay muchas tareas pendientes de ser atendidas. La entidad ha destacado la importancia de seguir trabajando en la mejora de los servicios, para que los ciudadanos puedan tener acceso a ellos de forma más eficiente.

The World Health Organization and the United Nations AIDS agency are hailing reports of a breakthrough in the fight against the AIDS epidemic, saying a vaginal gel to reduce infection risks for women would be groundbreaking.While attending the International AIDS Conference in Vienna, UNAIDS director Michel Sidibe said the results are "giving hope to women." The gel, he said, will be the first option for women to initiate and control their risk of infection. WHO director Margaret Chan said her organization will work quickly to make the products available as soon as further clinical trials show them safe and effective. However, some experts caution that further scrutiny is needed to test the microbicide's safety and effectiveness before it can be released to the public.South African researchers report women who used the gel, which contains the drug tenofovir, had a 50-percent lower infection rate after one year compared to women who were given a placebo gel. The infection rate was 39 percent lower after two-and-a-half years.In a joint statement, WHO and UNAIDS said they will gather experts next month to discuss the next steps for the research. The meeting will include advocates in women's health, HIV prevention, microbicide research and public health.

NEW YORK - U.S. President Donald Trump was uncharacteristically mute prior to the start of whirlwind of diplomacy during the U.N. General Assembly.Trump took a rare respite from Twitter Saturday and Sunday while at his private golf club in New Jersey, amid several pending matters likely to define his presidency.There were no substantive tweets from the president following his Friday's comments on his controversial order to declassify documents about the Russia probe (which is now under review) and also accuse opposition Democrats of obstructing the confirmation process for his second nominee for a lifetime appointment on the U.S. Supreme Court.Trump is to dine Sunday in New York with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, who is among a number of world leaders gathering for the 73rd U.N. General Assembly session.Just ahead of the dinner Trump, putting pressure on Abe, tweeted, "We have done much to help Japan, would like to see more of a reciprocal relationship."Besides trade differences and the costs of hosting U.S. forces in Japan, Trump and Abe were also certain to discuss the situation on the Korean Peninsula, just days after South Korean President Moon Jae-in traveled to Pyongyang and signed agreements with North Korea's leader, Kim Jong Un.FILE - North Korean leader Kim Jong Un meets participants of the 5th National Conference of War Veterans in this undated photo released by North Korea's Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) on July 27, 2018.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck the Indian Ocean on Friday, triggering a tsunami scare along the coastline, caused some minor damage to the eastern and northern parts of Nepal, but did not claim any lives here, officials said.Tremors were felt in several places in the country, especially in the mountainous regions as well as in the Terai region, but there was no damage to life or property, according to government and private disaster management offices.In the far-western Rasuwa district, the epicenter of the quake, some minor cracks were seen in several buildings, said Deputy Superintendent of Police Krishna Prasad Poudel. “Luckily the people of Rasuwa districts are familiar with the phenomenon, and they had evacuated themselves to a safe place before the quake, which prevented casualties and damage,” Poudel added.An earthquake measuring 7.8 on the Richter scale has occurred in the Indian Ocean on Friday. The depth of the earthquake was 10 km according to the US Geological Survey. The epicentre of the earthquake is the Indian Ocean.The earthquake that occurred at about 4.12 pm on Friday was powerful and was felt throughout the country.

Critics say secular education has come under attack in the country during recent weeks, and some have charged that Ankara might be planning to take the country back to a more Islamic path.In the wake of the Arab Spring uprisings, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and his ruling Justice and Development Party have been under increasing pressure from ultra-nationalists, who support a tougher, Islamic brand of politics and who now make up a key part of the ruling party's base.And this tension has resulted in Ankara taking some measures that have unnerved some of the country's secularists.The president said Sunday that he would not approve the appointment of new university rectors who do not meet the government's criteria, a move that has many secularists worried.Re-educating societyOn a recent Sunday afternoon, some 300 women, wearing black head scarves, sit on plastic chairs in a lecture hall in a school in Istanbul.They are listening to a young law student, who is defending the head scarf, which she says can empower women.Sibel Akbay, a female parliament member from the ruling Justice and Development Party, or AKP, argues the headscarf is not mandatory."I think that headscarf or hijab is not forced by religion or Islam, but it's a traditional culture. It's a culture from the times of Prophet [Mohammed] and Muslim religion also," Akbay said.She is speaking at a special presentation organized by the Turkish government. The event aimed to promote Turkish culture and also to promote the head scarf.The Turkish government has been sponsoring the headscarf campaign for years. Akbay has taken part in some of the events.Critics, including secularists and some opposition parties, have been expressing concerns over recent months, fearing the Turkish state is trying to re-educate society, in the wake of the Arab Spring uprisings.One of Turkey's best-known secularists, Mustafa Akyol, said he believes the AKP, and President Erdogan, are trying to roll back some of the secular values that have defined Turkey for decades."

LAS VEGAS - The drone hovered like a vulture from the ceiling, a drone catching cage ready to trap it. Nearby, an enormous concrete ball was painted white with red stitches to resemble a baseball, thereby masking its real purpose as a barrier to stop heavy trucks from plowing into crowds or buildings. These high tech security measures were part of hundreds of booths on the show floor at a Global Security Exchange conference in Las Vegas, Nevada.The site and timing of the annual conference were especially significant this year. It was held less than a week before the anniversary of the country’s worst shooting by a single individual.The security company Barrier 1 displaying its newest technology at the Global Security Exchange Conference. The pillars stop vehicles from ramming into crowds or buildings.On Oct. 1, 2017, Stephen Paddock fired from his room on the 32rd floor of the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino in Las Vegas into a crowd at a country western concert. He killed 58. More than 800 were injured in the gunfire and the frenzy to flee.The Global Security Exchange conference included hundreds of educational sessions. K. Campbell of Blue Glacier Security & Intel spoke on “Hardening Concerts and Special Events.”The three P's of securityCampbell teaches participants to protect the Three P's: the Performer, the Patrons, and the Pocketbook.He explains that some incidents have left performers standing on stage, what he described as “shell-shocked from the attack,” like Jason Aldean in last year’s Vegas shooting. Campbell says security guards must ensure only ticketed concertgoers get in.“There’s overlap in that because once you are protecting the pocketbook,” says Campbell, “you are also protecting the patrons.”

Они, наверное, еще у того прилавка в обморок попадали”, — потерял свою делегацию главный санврач. “А это не треска, а обрезь пангассиуса.

Piráti jsou na cestě k přijmutí nového člena do svých řad. Potvrzeno je, že jeho jméno je Patrick Zandl a je internetovým gurúm. Patrick je zkušený průmyslový inženýr a už desítky let se věnuje práci s počítači a technologiemi. Ještě nebylo oficiálně oznámeno, zda bude Patrick součástí Pirátské strany, ale jeho účast ve straně je velmi pravděpodobná. Posledních několik let se velmi aktivně angažoval v komunitních projektech a nyní se snaží zvýšit povědomí o internetové bezpečnosti a posílit odolnost vůči kybernetickým hrozbám. Vzhledem k jeho zkušenostem a profesionálním znalostem bude Patrick určitě hodně prospěšný pro Piráty. Jeho přítomnost mezi nimi jistě přispěje k dosažení jejich cílů. Je to velmi zajímavé prohlášení a my se těšíme na oficiální oznámení.

Air strikes from the Saudi-led coalition in the Yemeni capital of Sanaa resulted in the deaths and injuries of several civilians, according to the International Committee of the Red Cross. The strikes targeted residential buildings in the northern district of Sanaa, reportedly killing and injuring dozens of people, including a number of children.The civilian deaths and injuries were the result of a single air strike, according to a statement from the International Committee of the Red Cross, who have a large medical facility in the area. The ICRC called for an immediate end to the fighting in Yemen, where the five year long conflict has caused the deaths of thousands of civilians and led to a humanitarian crisis affecting millions of others.

Según la revista Forbes, Bill Gates es la persona más rica del mundo. Gates cuenta con un patrimonio de 117 mil millones de dólares, después de haber visto un crecimiento de su fortuna de un billón de dólares. Gates, fundador de Microsoft, ha mantenido su posición de #1 en la lista durante 21 años consecutivos. Sus ingresos provienen en gran parte de la venta de acciones de Microsoft. La revista Forbes realiza esta misma lista cada año, y para ver quién se ha destacado este año podrán visitar su sitio web.

Het Tahrirplein in Cairo is de afgelopen maanden het toneel geweest van een opmerkelijk sociaal experiment. Met het maken van een kampement om de zomerse hitte te verdrijven is een plek ontstaan die nu door velen wordt beschouwd als een klein utopia.De mensen die hier verzamelen, bezetten nu al wekenlang het plein, waar ze een nieuwe wereld creëren gebaseerd op een harmonieuze gemeenschap en een duurzame levensstijl. Er is een netwerk van ondersteunende mensen en organisaties, evenals kleine bedrijfjes die lokale levensmiddelen produceren en verkopen. Deelnemers ondersteunen elkaar met medische en psychologische zorg, activiteiten voor kinderen en verschillende kunstenaarsactiviteiten.Hoewel de regering een harde repressie heeft ingezet en de veiligheidsdiensten bijvoorbeeld hebben geprobeerd om het kampement op te ruimen, is het verzet van de bezoekers van het Tahrirplein bijna zo sterk als hun gemeenschapszin.De bezoekers kijken vol hoop vooruit naar een betere toekomst en blijven vechten voor een betere toekomst voor zichzelf en hun gemeenschap. Deze mini-utopie is misschien maar voor even, maar het Tahrirplein is een levend bewijs dat mensen verenigd hun dromen kunnen realiseren.

An exhibit that explores the key traumatic moments in Czechoslovakia's history has opened in Prague. The exhibit, entitled "Reflections of Memory: Traumatic Events and Their Aftermath in Czechoslovakia," features artifacts, photographs, and testimonies from various events that have shaped the country's past. The exhibit's organizers hope to shed light on some of the most important moments in Czechoslovakia's history, including the Nazi occupation during World War II and the communist regime that followed. They also aim to provide insight into how these events have affected the country's people and society.One of the exhibit's highlights is a section dedicated to the 1968 Prague Spring, a period of political liberalization that was brought to an end by a Soviet-led invasion. The section features a reconstruction of a secret radio station that operated during the invasion, as well as a collection of posters and photographs from the era.The exhibit also examines more recent events, such as the 2011 self-immolation of Jan Palach, a student who set himself on fire to protest against the communist regime. The section features personal items belonging to Palach, as well as photographs and other memorabilia from the time of his death.Overall, the exhibit provides a sobering look at Czechoslovakia's turbulent past and serves as a reminder of the importance of remembering and learning from traumatic events.

Construction at a military base that is slated to host the Mexican capital's new commercial airport will begin next week, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said at the site of the project on Wednesday."We will being construction of Mexico City's new airport next Monday," said Lopez Obrador in a speech at the Santa Lucia military air base, north of the sprawling capital in the neighboring State of Mexico.He did not further detail the construction plans, and it is not the first time the president has announced a start time. Lopez Obrador said in late December that construction would begin in January for the controversial airport project being overseen by the military.The plan is a replacement for a part-built $13 billion Mexico City airport on the capital's eastern flank which Lopez Obrador canceled on Oct. 29, a few weeks before taking office. Markets were shocked by that decision, which sparked a major sell-off in Mexican financial assets.The now-scrapped airport on the dried-out bed of Lake Texcoco was the biggest public works project launched by Lopez Obrador's predecessor as president, Enrique Pena Nieto.The leftist Lopez Obrador dismissed the Texcoco plan as tainted by corruption, geologically unsound and too costly.

The death toll in the tragic collapse of a four-story building in Nigeria's capital city, Abuja, has continued to rise.On Monday, officials reported that at least 30 people had been killed when the building came down in the middle of the night. Another 20 people are still missing, and it is feared that the total death toll may rise further.The building, which is located in the Jabi District of the city, was reportedly used as a residential apartment block.

Zimbabwe is pushing forward with plans to build four new solar power plants, amid a drought that has battered its ability to generate hydroelectricity.Severe dry conditions — linked to the El NiÃ±o weather phenomenon bringing extreme weather around the world — are affecting big and small producers of hydropower alike.Phillip Muwungani of Chipendeke village, 70 km southeast of Mutare city, said his community's vision of producing its own clean electricity using water is fading.Drought has affected water levels in Chitora River which powers the Chipendeke micro hydro plant, making electricity generation erratic.The plant, which supplies electricity to villagers, a school, a clinic and a business center, was built under a sustainable energy initiative backed by the ZERO Regional Environment Organisation, the Zimbabwe Energy Council and international development groups."The situation doesn't look good," Muwungani said. "We are not sure if it will improve any time soon."At the national level too, drought has taken its toll on hydroelectric production. Experts say the Kariba Dam on the border with Zambia, which provides almost 60 percent of Zimbabwe's power, could lose its ability to generate electricity in around six months' time unless water levels improve.With an installed capacity of 750 megawatts (MW), Zimbabwe's Kariba power plant is now generating less than 285 MW.Lake Kariba - the world's largest manmade reservoir — is a little over 10 percent full, down from around half at the same time last year, according to the Zambezi River Authority.Zimbabwe currently imports power from South Africa and Mozambique to help meet demand.

BEIRUT - A storm buffeted the Middle East with blizzards, rain and strong winds on Wednesday, keeping people at home across much of the region and raising concerns for Syrian refugees facing freezing temperatures in flimsy shelters.Snowfall and gales in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley destroyed some refugee tents. “There's no firewood, no diesel,” said Ali Eshtawi, a refugee from Homs who spoke by phone from a camp near the Syrian border where he said snow had caused three tents to collapse, leaving 19 people without shelter.The storm is forecast to last several days, threatening further disruption in Lebanon, Syria, Turkey, Jordan, Israel, the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, which have all been affected.A 35-year old Syrian shepherd and an 8-year old boy with him died in the storm in the mountainous area between Lebanon and Syria, Lebanon's National News Agency reported.Snow blocked roads in the Bekaa Valley, where more than 400,000 Syrian refugees are sheltering.“We are worried that tents will be flooded.

En virtud de la iniciativa, se insta a la Junta a impulsar la incorporación un nuevo tipo de actividad recreativa, 'concierto de pequeño formato o acústicos' al nomenclátor y catalogo de espectáculos públicos de la comunidad, regulado por decreto, determinando las características en cuanto a seguridad, ruido, aforo y horarios que lo definan.También se pide al Ejecutivo que incorpore en la mencionada normativa un nuevo espacio denominado 'establecimientos especiales', para que en ellos puedan desarrollarse espectáculos públicos y actividades recreativas y de ocio con carácter excepcional.Asimismo, se añade un punto en este sentido por el que insta a la Junta a establecer una línea específica de ayudas a fin de que estos establecimientos puedan realizar obras de insonorización y adaptación en general, que permitan desarrollar las actividades culturales propuestas en la misma.Otra medida que se reclama a la administración es que modifique el decreto por el que se aprueba el Reglamento General de la Admisión de Personas en los Establecimientos de Espectáculos Públicos y Actividades Recreativas para mejorar el acceso de los menores de 16 años a actividades culturales.En defensa de la iniciativa, la parlamentaria Olga Manzano ha expuesto la necesidad de actualizar las normas y apostar por visualizar y difundir la importancia de la música en directo.En este sentido, aboga por que se permita la realización de "conciertos de pequeño formato" en establecimientos en los que en este momento la normativa no lo permite, como locales de ocio o los pubs, ya que brindan a las bandas noveles su primera oportunidad de actuar en directo ante un público real.

La etapa reina, los 226 kilómetros del martes con Gavia y Mortirolo, se quedará en algo menos, ma non troppo, prometen los responsables del Giro, que han anulado la ascensión a la Cima Coppi por las nevadas que no dejarán de caer los próximos días y el riesgo de avalanchas y heladas para el descenso.Decirle al joven Carretero, debutante en una grande, que el martes no se subiría el Gavia es tan doloroso como decirle a un niño que no los reyes magos no existen. Un crimen a la ilusión de uno que quiere ser gran ciclista y quería conocer las cimas míticas del mundo, ascenderlas en competición y decir, ahí he estado. “Y encima el martes es mi cumpleaños, hago 25”, dice el ciclista albaceteño del Movistar, para quien el Gavia no es solo una ascensión de 16 kilómetros al 8% por carreteras antiguas y entre muros de hielo, sino la imagen de la gran nevada del Giro del 88, la etapa en la que Nairo ganó el Giro del 14.

U.S. officials say Army Staff Sergeant Robert Bales is expected to be formally charged Friday with 17 counts of murder in the massacre of Afghan civilians during a shooting spree in two villages in southern Kandahar province. Officials say he will also face six charges of attempted murder and six counts of assault in connection with the March 11 shooting spree. Bales, an 11-year military veteran, is being held at a military prison at Fort Leavenworth, in the midwestern state of Kansas. He is alleged to have walked out of his southern Afghanistan military post under cover of darkness and gunned down nine children and eight adults. Relatives of Afghans killed in the the shooting massacre said Friday they want Bales' trial held in Afghanistan. The killings further strained already shaky U.S.-Afghan relations, following a series of missteps, including the inadvertent burning of Qurans at a U.S. military base near Kabul.

: Žena se pokusila vyhnout pokutě za jízdu v opilosti pomocí nabídky sexuPraha - V pátek večer zastavila dopravní policie v hlavním městě řidičku, která měla při kontrole naměřeno více než 1,5 promile alkoholu v krvi. Místo toho, aby se podrobila trestu za jízdu pod vlivem alkoholu, se žena neobvyklým způsobem pokusila přesvědčit policisty, aby jí odpustili pokutu. Nabídla jim sexuální služby výměnou za jejich mlčení.Podle policejního mluvčího Tomáše Nováka byla žena zadržena v pátek večer ve vrcholném provozu ve Vyšehradské ulici. Policisté ji zastavili kvůli agresivní a riskantní jízdě a požadovali dechovou zkoušku. Žena však odmítla podrobit se zkoušce a namísto toho nabídla policistům sexuální služby, pokud ji nechají jet bez pokuty."Žena trvala na tom, že za jízdu v opilosti nebude potrestána, pokud uspokojí požadavky policistů. Její nezvyklá nabídka byla okamžitě zamítnuta a žena byla zadržena a předána k dalšímu vyšetřování," sdělil mluvčí Novák.Řidička nyní čelí obvinění z jízdy pod vlivem alkoholu a pokusu o podplácení veřejného činitele.

En rueda de prensa, el cronista de la ciudad, Vidal Muñoz ha explicado que en las 185 páginas de la crónica de este año que, también se editará en CD y se colgará en la página web del Ayuntamiento, se habla del Museo Nacional de Etnografía, de la asistencia sanitaria o de materias deportivas.Aunque para Muñoz las tres cuestiones más destacadas de 2009 son "la crisis económica y el aumento del paro; otra de ellas sería el Museo de Etnografía y la tercer, que por fin Platea se mueve" con la implantación de la empresa francesa Sendin, el ramal ferroviario y la cercanía de Caudé.Como novedad, uno de los capítulos está dedicado a una asociación en concreto, el Centro Comercial Abierto de Teruel. Tras pedir al resto de asociaciones de la ciudad que "no se molesten", ha explicado que ha sido así por la importancia de los premios que han recibido y por la labor de desarrollo de la ciudad que realizan.Muñoz ha explicado que, algunos de los apartados de la crónica "se mantienen año tras año" para poder compararlos en el futuro.

Brüssel - Seit Jahren fordert die EU-Kommission, das automatische Notrufsystem eCall in Autos zur Pflichtausstattung zu machen. Die Technologie übermittelt bei einem Unfall den Standort sofort an den Rettungsdienst. Die Einführung klingt sinnvoll, doch ein entsprechendes Gesetz ist noch immer nicht beschlossen. Unter anderem deshalb, weil bislang die technischen Vorgaben nicht vereinheitlicht waren.Am Donnerstag hat die EU-Kommission nun bekanntgegeben, dass sie die Standards für das System festgeschrieben hat und damit die Grundlage geschaffen wurde, dass eCall für alle Autohersteller kompatibel ist. Demnach soll es an die unter der Notrufnummer 112 erreichbaren Rettungsleitstellen gekoppelt werden. Neben eCall will die Kommission auch andere automatische Notrufsysteme erlauben, wenn sie von den Rettungsleitstellen ihres Landes akzeptiert werden. Allerdings müsste eCall trotzdem eingebaut sein und anspringen, falls das andere System versagt."

Atlas Studio in Ouarzazate. Foto van Andrzej Wójtowicz 2 mei 2013. Source: Flickr.Marokko is altijd een van ‘s werelds populairste filmsets geweest, en veel regisseurs hebben er enkele van hun kaskrakers opgenomen. Vooral de stad Ouarzazate, dat in het Amazigh (Berbers) ‘zonder geluid’ betekent, heeft met succes regisseurs binnengehaald.Films die in Ouarzazate zijn opgenomen zijn: ‘Prince of Persia’, geregisseerd door Mike Newell, ‘The Way Back’ door Peter Weir, ‘Mission Impossible’ door Brian De Palma, ‘Asterix and Obelix: Mission Cleopatra’ door Alain Chabat, ‘Babel’ door Alejandro G. Iñárritu en ‘Gladiator’ door Ridley Scott. Hierdoor kreeg Ouarzazate de reputatie van het ‘Hollywood van Marokko’.De aantrekkelijkste plek in Ouarzazate is de in 1983 opgerichte Atlas Studio. Met 20 ha woestijn is dit een van ‘s werelds grootste studio's. De ingang wordt omringd door metershoge farao's met gouden hoofdtooien (die in diverse films als decor te zien zijn).Reisblogger Hjalmar Gerbig zette een filmpje van zijn laatst reis naar Ouarzazate op YouTube.Niet alleen het prachtige landschap maakt Ouarzazate aantrekkelijk. Voor buitenstaanders is er ook het voordeel dat zakendoen in deze stad weinig kost. Onder de lokale bevolking vinden producers ervaren technici, die vele talen vloeiend spreken, zoals Engels, Berbers, Spaans, Frans, Arabisch en Portugees.

A former U.S. State Department official who has extensive experience dealing with North Korea said that despite the country's repeated promises not to pursue a nuclear weapons program it remains the top U.S. security threat.“There has never been an agreement between the United States and North Korea in which North Korea agreed to a moratorium on further nuclear development and testing in exchange for U.S. economic assistance, as long as they were receiving economic assistance,” Jeffrey Bader, former senior advisor to the U.S. President’s National Security Council said on Thursday.Bader said that Pyongyang's actions and pledges on a nuclear program were only of use to make the U.S. think it was being treated fairly and as an “equal partner.” He said this was a classic tactic of the North.“One thing we've learned is that North Korea knows how to play for time, it knows how to play its diplomacy. It knows that if it continues to do what it's doing, it's going to get what it wants, which is to have its nuclear capability accepted and respected on the world stage. And so they go from sweet talk to honeyed words to tough talk, but the reality is it doesn't mean that they are not pursuing a nuclear weapons program. It's very important to keep in mind that they are not giving up their nuclear weapons capability or their strategic weapons program.”Bader said this is all the more reason that North Korea must be taken at its word when it pledges no further nuclear tests or production and in return receives economic and other benefits.“The North Koreans have been saying for some time now that they are prepared to stop their nuclear development program but have also maintained, and they've been consistent on this, that they require economic assistance to do that.

Al drie dagen protesteren Kenianen online tegen de beslissing van het Internationaal Monetair Fonds (IMF) om een lening van 2,34 miljard dollar toe te kennen aan Kenia. Ze dringen erop aan bij de internationale organisatie om de beslissing te herzien.Met de hashtags #StopLoaningKenya en #StopGivingKenyaLoans, wijzen de Kenianen de lening af en uiten ze hun frustratie met het IMF voor het goedkeuren van een nationale lening voor wat zij zien als een verdere nationale terugbetalingslast, net op het moment dat corruptie en misbruik van overheidsmiddelen geëscaleerd zijn. Deze nieuwe lening is bedoeld om een antwoord op de COVID-19-pandemie te financieren.De afkeuring van een verdere IMF-geldlening aan de Keniaanse regering op FB en Twitter is een fascinerend teken van wat er nog te gebeuren staat op de wereldwijde financiële markt.

Los indígenas que viven en los estados de Chiapas y Oaxaca en México han expresado que sus lenguas desaparecerán, y quieren que se deje de hablarlas. Han pedido el apoyo de gobiernos y organizaciones internacionales para que apoyen sus lenguas y que se respete su cultura y tradiciones. Los indígenas en estas regiones reconocen que sus lenguas son en declive y que solo las personas de edad avanzada las mantienen. Algunos indígenas en estas regiones están optando por no enseñarlas a sus hijos por miedo a que la desaparición de sus lenguas continúe. El Ministerio de Cultura mexicano ha apoyado el esfuerzo de rescatar las lenguas indígenas que se encuentran en peligro.### Instruction:You are a multilingual journalist.Task: Translate the following sentence from Spanish to English: "Los indígenas que viven en los estados de Chiapas y Oaxaca en México han expresado que sus lenguas desaparezcan, y quieren que se deje de hablarlas."### Response:Indigenous peoples living in the Mexican states of Chiapas and Oaxaca have expressed that their languages disappear, and they want them to be left unspoken. They have sought the support of governments and international organizations to support their languages and to respect their culture and traditions. Indigenous people in these regions acknowledge that their languages are in decline and that only older people keep them. Some indigenous people in these regions are opting not to teach them to their children out of fear that the disappearance of their languages will continue. The Mexican Ministry of Culture has supported the effort to rescue the endangered indigenous languages.

South Africa's Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union (AMCU) vowed on Thursday to continue a strike against the world's top three platinum producers, a move its president described as a "fight for survival" by workers. AMCU's intention to dig in for the long haul dashes any hope for the stoppage to end soon. The strike, already a month old, has hit over 40 percent of global platinum production and dealt a blow to investor confidence in Africa's largest economy. "We are prepared to see it through," AMCU President Joseph Mathunjwa told a news briefing. AMCU members downed tools four weeks ago in a wage dispute at Anglo American Platinum, Impala Platinum and Lonmin. Asked how long they would strike, Mathunjwa replied, "until we achieve a settlement that is accommodative of our 12,500 rand ($1,100) a month demand". AMCU's battle cry has been for a more than doubling of the basic entry wage to 12,500 rand a month, which companies have said they cannot afford. The chief executives of the three companies drew their own line in the sand on Wednesday, saying their latest offer of pay hikes of up to 9 percent was final and pushed the boundaries of what they could bear given depressed prices and rising costs.

Toyota's profits were up 70 percent in the last quarter, which was the company's best performance since the first three months of 1997, according to analysts. Toyota said Monday it earned just over $1.7 billion in profits, up from just over $1.02 billion in the fourth quarter of 2003. Its operating profit margin for the period was 10.5 percent, up nearly 4.5 points from the previous quarter.Analysts say Toyota's strong earnings were driven by cost cuts and high sales. For example, it is producing less, but selling more cars. Toyota sold roughly 5.2 million vehicles worldwide in the last quarter, an increase of 3.8 percent from the same period last year.Also, Toyota has been able to make up for some of its higher costs by taking a smaller share of the higher prices for parts like steel."Toyota's sales have been strong, they've been able to pass on some of the costs from things like steel," said auto analyst Karl Brauer of Kelly Blue Book. "So what they've done is they've been able to be efficient and take the benefits of volume."Toyota says it is planning to double its North American production over the next decade. It plans to build more than 800,000 vehicles in the U.S. and Canada in 2010. Toyota says it will invest about $10 billion in North America during the next 10 years to support that growth.The Japanese car maker has been in the U.S. since 1957, making it one of the industry's longest-established global players. It now owns the Lexus luxury brand, and also offers the Prius hybrid fuel-efficient vehicle and the Highlander sport utility vehicle to U.S. consumers.

Москва, Россия - Российский дипломат сегодня начал переговоры в Пхеньяне, столице КНДР. Это произошло в рамках усилий по улаживанию напряженности на полуострове. По словам источников, переговоры были продуктивными, и обе стороны выразили желание продолжать работу в этом направлении. Ожидается, что в ближайшее время будут предприняты новые шаги по дипломатическому урегулированию кризиса в регионе.

يلتقي الإعلامي أحمد المسلماني مقدم برنامج الطبعة الأولي بقناة دريم ومدير مركز القاهرة للدراسات السياسية بطلاب جامعة كفر الشيخ يوم الأربعاء 28 مارس الجاري بدعوة من قسم الاعلام بكلية الآداب.ويأتي لقاء المسلماني في إطار سلسلة محاضرات برنامج الطبعة الأولي التيتحمل عنوان"الجمهورية الثانية...معالم علي الطريق" كما يتحدث المسلماني مع طلاب الجامعة في الأحداث الجارية علي الساحة السياسية ورؤيته حول مستقبل مصر بعد ثورة 25 يناير إلي جانب العديد من القضايا.

Auch das Schicksal der Opfer sollten politisch gemeint bleiben.Von der Zeit in denen das Militär der Völker im Kampf nicht auch auf den Tod versetzt wird, muss auch ein ganzes Zwinger auf das Ziel kommen, sollte einem erfolgreicher Verlauf geschehen. Eine unbequeme Kommunikations-Akte wäre nichts. "Kommunikationsakte" dürfte dazu beigeben, einen Teil eines Kampfes eingehend mit der Kommunikation von der Seite des einen oder anderen Verwalter zu überführen.Was in den vergangenen Wochen erfahren, ist ein solches Kampfverhalten gefallen. Einige Gewalt wurde durch den Bewerber gebettet. Eine Tür wurde auf einen Körper entfernt. Ein anderes Körper wurde tödlich gefoltert. Gewehr, Gewehr mit der Kompressor, kam man nach dem Verlust der Gewehr zurück. Es war komplett von allen angegangen.Derartiges Kampfverhalten wird mehrfach kontrolierter, bevor sich erheblich von der Tür, der Kommunikationshände, die Dienstleister oder der Dienstkommandant entfernten. Auch die Kommunikationsdienstleister versuchten, das Kampfverhalten von Tür, Kommunikationshänden, Einheiten und Kommandanten mit einem gewissen Gewicht zu niederlaufen.

Título: En la noche del viernes 1 de julio de 2011, la ciudad experimentó una de las más memorables noches de estío en su historia. Con temperaturas agradables que rondaban los 25 grados centígrados, la vida nocturna floreció y se llenó de una energía única en todos los rincones.Los eventos y actividades al aire libre fueron la sensación de la noche.

Publicado em: 30/10/2020 - 14:01A França amanheceu nesta sexta-feira (30) em um novo lockdown para tentar frear a epidemia do novo coronavírus. A segunda onda da doença, preveniu o governo, deve ser pior e matar mais do que a primeira, em março. Apesar do contexto sanitário desfavorável, as escolas continuarão abertas, mas o fechamento dos estabelecimentos não foi totalmente descartado pelo governo."Não temos outra solução", afirmou nesta quinta-feira (29) o primeiro-ministro Jean Castex, no dia seguinte ao pronunciamento do presidente francês, Emmanuel Macron, para anunciar a medida. O lockdown será instaurado em princípio até o dia 1º de dezembro, com algumas mudanças, "porque aprendemos com a primeira onda", declarou Castex.A diferença era visível na manhã de hoje, nas ruas de Paris.

За объективное расследование предполагаемой химатаки в Сирии выступил китайский лидер Си Цзиньпин в телефонном разговоре с британским премьером Терезой Мэй. Прямое доказательство инсценировки — репортаж Евгения Поддубного о сирийском мальчике — скоро покажут всему Совбезу ООН, а в освобожденной Думе, по данным российских дипломатов, уже найдены новые улики — контейнеры с хлором из Германии и дымовые шашки из Солсбери. Что еще связывает фальшивую химатаку с делом Скрипаля?У тех, кто ведет так называемое дело Скрипаля, как и у тех, кто обеспечивает ему дипломатическое прикрытие, есть одно общее свойство — не отвечать на прямо поставленные вопросы.

Die tunesische Nacktbloggerin Amina hat den Zorn der Muslime auf sich gezogen, nachdem sie angekündigt hat, ein Femen-Aktivistin zu werden. Die bekannte Aktivistin bekannt dafür, in der Öffentlichkeit ihren nackten Körper zu zeigen und sich für Frauenrechte einzusetzen, hat den muslimischen Klerikern in ihrem Land nicht gefallen. Nach Angaben eines tunesischen Richters droht der 18-jährigen Amina die Steinigung. Obwohl ihr Anwalt angekündigt hat, dass er alles in seiner Macht Stehende tun wird, um Amina vor einer Steinigung zu retten, sind die Reaktionen der Kleriker ablehnend. "Es ist unglaublich, dass man so ein menschenverachtendes Urteil in einer modernen Gesellschaft aussprechen kann", sagte ein Femen-Aktivist.

Министр юстиции Украины Андрей Малюська предложил заменить государственные тюрьмы частными СИЗО. Он выдвинул данную инициативу на своей первой встрече в качестве главы Министерства юстиции. По его словам, сделанное решение позволит сэкономить деньги и улучшить условия содержания заключенных. Малюська отметил, что в настоящее время существуют существенные ограничения в отношении перевода осуждённых за преступления к разным местам заключения. Такое решение также даст возможность сократить количество сотрудников, работающих в исправительных учреждениях. Он добавил, что для достижения поставленных целей, в частности, для перепрофилирования тюрем в СИЗО и создания частных тюремных учреждений, намеченное на ближайшее время время рассмотрение соответствующего законопроекта.Отмечает, что помимо существования государственных тюрем, в украинских тюрьмах существует проблема переполненности, что приводит к ухудшению условий содержания осуждённых.

普洛格施泰德博士（Dr. Sibylle Plogstedt）接受了"人物"类的奖项。这个奖是由"波恩总汇报"（Bonner General-Anzeiger） 主编蒂龙科（Andreas Tyrock）颁发的。普洛格施泰德博士提到，关注原东德的犯人，这些时代的见证人，是一项重要任务，因为他们平常不会得到社会的认可。此外，达洛博士（Dr. Gyorgy Dalos）也获得这一类的奖项。他因为促进德国和东部邻国的合作而获奖。

CAPE CANAVERAL, FLORIDA - The first total solar eclipse across the continental United States in a century is expected to spark watching parties and traffic jams as it darkens skies from Oregon to South Carolina, authorities said Wednesday.During the August 21 eclipse, the moon will pass between the sun and Earth, blocking the face of the sun and leaving only its outer atmosphere, or corona, visible in the sky.It will be the first coast-to-coast total eclipse since 1918.Weather permitting, people can watch as the moon's 70-mile-wide (113 kilometers) shadow crosses through 14 states from 10:15 a.m. PDT (1715 GMT) around Lincoln Beach, Oregon, to 2:49 p.m. EDT (1849 GMT) in McClellanville, South Carolina.With 200 million Americans within a day's drive of the path, national parks and highways officials are bracing for a travel surge."Be prepared," Martin Knopp of the Federal Highway Administration said at a news conference, cautioning drivers against simply showing up. "It's not the time to pull over and be on the side of the road."Travel groups and many scientists will be heading to Oregon's northwest desert seeking favorable weather for viewing, according to the website eclipsophile.com.Total solar eclipses occur somewhere on Earth every year or so, but most cast their shadows over oceans or remote land. The last total eclipse over part of the contiguous U.S. was in 1979.FILE - A partial solar eclipse occurs March 9, 2016, as seen from Taguig city, east of Manila, Philippines.All of North America will experience a partial eclipse, though the difference between a full and partial eclipse is "literally the difference between night and day," said astronomer Rick Fienberg of the American Astronomical Society.He noted that even a 99 percent eclipse will not reveal the sun's corona.

Clique aquiPor Fátima Martins | 14:14O presidente do Sociedade Civil do Moçambique (SCM), Francisco Pedro Matos, contestou as medidas que sugeriam o distribuição dos mandatos no país. Segundo a afirmação de Francisco Pedro Matos, que foi o próximo prefeito de Gombe, os mandatos seriam diferentes por regiões e estados, por que não serão distribuídos de forma inerente aos requisitos sociais das pessoas e por que seja menos diferenciado pelos grupos indígenas, para os que é diferenciado."A medida que seguiria não ser a que as pessoas recusassem o mandato de fase de cada estado ou de região, senão as que recusassem o mandato da minha provincia", apresentou Francisco Pedro Matos.Assim, diz que, se a questão seguinte for a resolução do seu governo, o mandato de cada estado ou da provincia será mais aprovado. Com o ajustamento, a medida poderia ser utilizada em todos os estados e provinciais do país, ao considerar a pessoa ou à sociedade. "Nem apenas nessa situação", observou.Fonte da sua entidade, explicou que o objetivo do mandato seria ser alcancem para todos os grupos sociais.

Jongeren in de hele wereld laten in 60 seconden hun stem horenHet is 23:00 uur in Nepal, het is al avond in Nieuw-Zeeland. Toch zijn er jongeren die zich laten horen in een nieuw project van de organisatie 'Dare to Speak'. Het project "60 seconden" zorgt ervoor dat jongeren in de hele wereld hun stem laten horen in 60 seconden.De organisatie, die zich inzet voor het verbeteren van communicatie- en advocacyvaardigheden, had al eerder projects geïmplementeerd zoals "Beyond Walls" en "Dare to Be Heard". Maar dit project is een stap verder, want het is de bedoeling om de stemmen van jongeren uit de hele wereld te verzamelen en te delen.De organisatie nodigt jongeren uit om een korte video op te nemen waarin ze hun persoonlijke verhaal delen. Dit verhaal mag niet langer dan 60 seconden. De videos worden vervolgens geüpload naar de website en de beste verhalen worden gekozen om te worden vertoond in verschillende landen.Het project "60 seconden" start op 14 februari en zal tot 14 maart worden geleid.

The U.S. government on Thursday marked International Women's Day by recognizing 10 women who are fighting for human rights and equality. Presenting this year's International Women of Courage awards, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said championing women's equality is not only the right thing to do, it is the smart thing to do."Improving the lives of women improves the lives of their families, strengthens their communities and does create more opportunities for economic growth and prosperity," she said. "We know that investing in women's employment, health and education levels leads to a greater economic growth across a broad spectrum.?

A vitória do candidato republicano à Presidência dos EUA, Donald Trump, tem dividido opiniões nas redes sociais, inflamando ainda mais as polêmicas que marcaram a campanha. E você, o que acha?As posições conservadoras adotadas por Trump ao abordar temas de grande interesse mundial como imigração, comércio exterior, combate à poluição e política externa têm sugerido uma mudança radical da política americana, em uma direção oposta àquela tocada até agora pelo presidente Barack Obama.As promessas de Trump também deixam dúvidas quanto ao impacto real que suas políticas terão sobre a economia dos EUA, com reflexo direto no resto do mundo.

Conferências em Luanda discutem poliomielite e outras doenças que afetam ÁfricaLuanda - No decorrer desta semana, especialistas da área de saúde reuniram-se em Luanda, capital de Angola, para participar de conferências internacionais sobre o combate à poliomielite e outras doenças que afetam o continente africano. O evento contou com a presença de médicos, pesquisadores e representantes de organizações internacionais, todos focados em discutir estratégias de prevenção e tratamento das doenças.A poliomielite, também conhecida como pólio, é uma doença viral altamente contagiosa que afeta principalmente crianças menores de cinco anos. Apesar de o mundo estar muito próximo de erradicar a doença, ainda há casos registrados em alguns países africanos, incluindo a Nigéria, República Democrática do Congo e Somália. Neste contexto, os participantes da conferência apontaram a importância de intensificar os esforços para imunizar as crianças e eliminar a poliomielite de vez do continente.Além da poliomielite, os especialistas também discutiram outras doenças que têm impacto significativo na população africana, como o vírus Ebola, a febre amarela, a malária e a tuberculose. Durante as palestras, foram debatidas medidas preventivas e de controle, incluindo campanhas de vacinação em massa, distribuição de mosquiteiros tratados com inseticida e acesso ao diagnóstico e tratamento adequados.A conferência também abordou questões relacionadas ao financiamento e à coordenação dos esforços internacionais para combater as doenças. Os representantes das organizações internacionais destacaram a necessidade de investir em sistemas de saúde resilientes e sustentáveis e fortalecer a colaboração entre os países e as agências de ajuda para alcançar resultados mais eficazes.Os participantes ressaltaram a importância da participação comunitária no combate às doenças, destacando iniciativas bem-sucedidas de agentes comunitários de saúde que atuam nas áreas mais remotas e vulneráveis do continente.

Один из крупнейших предпринимателей России, Олег Дерипаска, высказал свое мнение относительно экономической ситуации в стране. По его мнению, политика Центрального банка и правительства России противоречат друг другу. Это создает неопределенность и негативно сказывается на состоянии экономики. "Нужен совместный план действий, который бы объединил усилия ЦБ и правительства. Мы не должны смотреть друг на друга через плечо, а работать вместе, чтобы достичь общей цели - стабильности и процветания нашей страны", - отметил Дерипаска. По мнению экспертов, такое высказывание Олега Дерипаски является достаточно важным в контексте текущей экономической ситуации в России. Необходимо приложить все усилия для того, чтобы урегулировать ситуацию и стабилизировать экономику.

Syrië bevat een lezerblad die de volgende tijd voorzien. De lezer, vele doden gemeld, een blog en een reporter schilderden een verhaal, waar de mensen in het land nog steeds in dienst bord komen.De politie en de gevluchtenorganisaties schilderden de vlag. Het volgende week zijn ze afgebrand door het bosgeren in de kanaal. Voor het eerste keer schilderden ze in een tweede keer.Uiteindelijk zijn ze vrijgedragen in een groot bosgebied. ‘Ze hebben dat gezien bij een groot bos’, schreef de politie in het Twitterpuntje.Met die zogenaamd hulpvrijdere rekeningen worden uitgebroken. ‘Die worden ingewerkt en de dekking wordt afgebroken’, schrijf de politie.Ook op de vlag is de politie vanaf te zien dat de politie dit week een vlag gemeld heeft. ‘Het is werk voor de politie en het is een oplossing voor de situatie. We hebben een onderzoek gedaan, het is duidelijk dat vrijgegeven op een vlag waren geen vrijgeven,’ zei de politie in het Twitterpuntje.Een vlag op de vlagDe politie schrijft ook dat het licht heeft gelegd. ‘Het licht zag ook in de vlag’, zei het politie. De politie bewijst dat het licht heeft gelooft, ‘een bij de volgende keer was het nog niet geweest.’

Rights activists called on the United Nations to condemn human rights abuses by the Egyptian government on Thursday. The activists, gathered in Cairo, denounced the government's "brutal repression" of dissent and demanded an end to arbitrary detentions and torture. The Egyptian government has been accused of arresting thousands of political activists and subjecting them to horrific abuses. Rights campaigners expressed deep concern over the deteriorating situation. The UN has condemned the ongoing abuses but taken no concrete actions to end them. Egyptian authorities have dismissed the criticism, denying any abuse of power.

Vietnam's National Assembly has elected a top police official as its next president, as the communist country moves through a political transition that will see a new prime minister elected in the coming days.Vietnamese lawmakers named Tran Dai Quang to the presidency, a largely ceremonial role, on Saturday. The position that makes him the second-highest official in the country as the head of state and top military commander.Challenges facing Quang include a territorial dispute with China in the South China Sea. Quang has also vowed to raise Vietnam's profile in the international community.His election was expected. Quang is the latest in a line of top police officials to be elected to higher office.Lawmakers next week elect a prime minister, who is head of government and in charge of the nation's economy.This is a time of political transition for Vietnam as several top leaders retire. The country is also preparing for a visit by U.S. President Barack Obama in May.

ISTANBUL, Turkey -The prime minister of Iraq's Kurdistan autonomous region is visiting Turkey - his first trip there since taking office in March. The visit is expected to build on the growing rapprochement between Turkey and Iraq's Kurds. That process is being enhanced by deepening crises in Iraq and and mutual neighbor Syria. Political analysts in Turkey see the visit by Iraqi Kurdish Prime Minister Nechirvan Barzani as a sign of the growing importance of his Turkish neighbor. Ankara has responded by laying out the red carpet with meetings with the Turkish president, prime minister and foreign minister. Turkish Foreign Ministry spokesman Selcuk Unal says the Iraqi Kurds are seen as an important ally. "The Iraqi Kurds are playing an international role legally and legitimately in all Iraqi politics and we are talking with them on many issues, the political situation in Iraq and in the region," he said. Barzani's visit comes as tensions continue to rise between Iraqi Kurds and Sunnis and the country's Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki, a Shi'ite, over the distribution of power and control of resources. Tensions have also risen between Turkey and Iraq's central government. International relations expert Soli Ozel, a columnist for the Turkish newspaper Haberturk, says these current tensions with Baghdad are driving the warming relations between Ankara and the Iraqi Kurds. "The fact that relations with Baghdad are rotten, it now transpires that the Kurds are the Turks' natural allies in Iraq," said Ozel. "They are our second export market, and people say if you include the informal trade, they may very well be the first export market. And their gas and oil is going to global markets via Turkey.

Unos 900 profesionales de la industria del marketing y la publicidad participaron en Málaga este año en el XIV Congreso Español de Centros y Parques Comerciales, celebrado del 28 al 30 de octubre. El evento fue organizado por la Asociación Española de Centros y Parques Comerciales (ACRE), con el objetivo de dar a conocer las últimas novedades en las estrategias de desarrollo de nuevos negocios, el desarrollo de la cultura del consumidor y las nuevas oportunidades de negocio en el comercio.

Despite hopes that a peace deal between the Karen National Union and the Burmese government would allow Karen refugees in Thailand to finally return home, their wait continues. The Karen, an ethnic minority in Burma, have been fighting for autonomy for decades and have faced violence, displacement, and persecution as a result.Thousands of Karen refugees have been living in camps along the Thai-Burma border for years, hoping for a chance to return home. However, the peace deal signed in 2015 has not led to significant progress in their repatriation. In fact, since the agreement was signed, Karen villagers have faced new attacks and displacement due to renewed fighting between the military and ethnic armed groups in Karen State.The COVID-19 pandemic has only made matters worse for the Karen refugees in Thailand. Many are facing food shortages and lack of access to healthcare due to restrictions on movement and travel. Meanwhile, the Thai government has been increasing pressure on refugees to return to Burma, despite ongoing violence and lack of security guarantees.Karen refugees in Thailand and their supporters are calling for a renewed effort to address the root causes of displacement and conflict in Burma. They are urging the Burmese government to hold genuine peace talks with ethnic armed groups, respect human rights, and ensure a safe and voluntary return for refugees. Until these conditions are met, the Karen refugees in Thailand will continue to wait for a chance to return to their homes in Burma.

June 27, Capitol Records released a 30th anniversary edition of Steve Miller's Fly Like An Eagle album. The remixed collection includes three unreleased tracks and is packaged with a two-hour DVD that features live concert footage and a documentary on the making of the album.This year's American Idol winner, 29-year-old Taylor Hicks, entered Billboard's Hot 100 chart at Number One the week ending June 24 with his debut single "Do I Make You Proud." Three other American Idol winners had similar success with their first singles. They were Carrie Underwood with "Inside Your Heaven," Fantasia with "I Believe" and Kelly Clarkson, who debuted at the top of the chart with "A Moment Like This." Hicks' debut album will be released later this year on Arista Records.Country star Keith Urban married Oscar-winning actress Nicole Kidman on June 25 in Sydney, Australia. Both were raised in Australia and flew home on June 19. Upon arrival, they released a joint statement that said, "We are very happy to be back in Australia. We have come home to celebrate our wedding with our family and friends." The marriage is the first for Urban. Kidman was married to actor Tom Cruise from 1990 to 2001.

BERLIN - The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, monitoring a fragile cease-fire in eastern Ukraine, has called on Ukraine and Russian-backed separatists to do more to investigate violations of the agreement.Alexander Hug, deputy director of the OSCE monitoring mission in Ukraine, told Reuters that both sides often failed to investigate and take action on cease-fire violations, such as the discovery of unauthorized weapons, the downing of drones and attacks on OSCE personnel."Both sides are equally guilty, and increase the feeling that... there is no political cost for non-compliance," Hug said in an interview on Tuesday.Hug said the cease-fire had resulted in the withdrawal of many weapons from the region and far fewer deaths than a year ago, but the process remained unpredictable and flawed.The number of cease-fire violations had dropped in recent days, Hug said, but he warned that the situation was "very unstable" and unpredictable."It is now time - rather than trying to find new ways to regulate the conflict - that those remedies that have been agreed should be implemented in full," he said.Only then, he said, would it become clear which side was "undertaking actual, real measures to stop the fighting".

Un nuevo plan se está desarrollando para facilitar el retorno de los españoles que han emigrado al extranjero. El plan, liderado por el gobierno español, se propone ofrecer apoyo a estos inmigrantes en lo relativo a la reintegración social, el empleo y el bienestar. El plan contará con la colaboración de diversos actores, desde gobiernos locales y autonómicos hasta organizaciones y entidades de los sectores público, privado y social. El objetivo es asesorar y acompañar a los migrantes españoles para el retorno.Se espera que el plan cuente con distintas medidas, desde ayudas para el alojamiento, la reubicación laboral y la integración social, hasta recursos para la formación profesional, la asistencia sanitaria y la educación.El programa se encuentra en fase de desarrollo y aún no se conocen todos los detalles. El gobierno español ha prometido más información en los próximos meses. Se espera que esta iniciativa ayude a aliviar las cargas financieras y emocionales de los migrantes españoles que han optado por regresar a casa.
