Havana's new president, Miguel Diaz-Canel, is putting his stamp on his nation — but without the kind of change that one might expect from a democratic leader on this island.It’s not as if Diaz-Canel is a new guy; he’s been leader of Cuba since 2008, taking over from Fidel Castro. But Diaz-Canel isn’t a new face to the island, and the country is no stranger to his leadership style. He was born in 1930 and came of age under Fidel’s rule, becoming a member of the revolutionary cadre. He later took over his mentor’s seat in the late 1960s.Since that time, he has been involved in the political process. He has been a senator, an ambassador, a member of the central committee of the Communist Party and the secretary of the party’s international bureau.It’s no wonder then that he would have expected to take office as president.To Diaz-Canel, this was no different than serving as his mentor’s right-hand man and being a key figure behind the scenes in Cuba’s communist movement. The difference is in the style and substance of change.Diaz-Canel has not only taken a bold stand of moving Cuba in the right direction but also in many areas where people feel some progress has been made. He has put forth his own ideas on many issues and they are more in keeping with his socialist beliefs than those of the U.S. The two are not exactly in alignment, but even moreso because their approaches to solving many issues on the island differ in many respects.For example, his views on the Cuban Missile Crisis have caused conflict on both sides in the island. It seems that the U.S. is no longer on board with a solution that would have put an end to the Cold War, while the Cuban government and its leaders want to find a diplomatic solution to the crisis.Diaz-Canel’s commitment to fighting AIDS in Cuba, and his insistence that doctors get to help as much as possible has put him on the side of his ideological ally.

A bad flu season in the United States just got worse, with a sharp increase in hospitalizations and deaths in recent weeks. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, deaths from flu have increased from 19 to 24 per 100,000 people since last week. This is the highest mortality rate observed since the 2009 flu pandemic. In addition, hospitalizations from flu-related complications rose by 83 percent over the past week. This is the highest number of hospitalizations reported since the end of the 2017-18 flu season. The CDC said that the majority of the hospitalizations were among the elderly, children and people with underlying medical conditions. The widespread virus has prompted federal health officials to urge Americans to get a flu shot, saying that it is the best way to protect against the illness.

MARIANA, BRAZIL - The search for more than 20 people missing after a dam break buried the tiny Brazilian village of Bento Rodrigues in mining waste was suspended for the night late Saturday.One death was confirmed and at least 24 workers and residents of several small towns were missing. Only about 600 people live in Bento Rodrigues, in Brazil's central Minas Gerais state.A reservoir holding tons of iron ore waste burst Thursday, followed by a second dam holding water. A huge river of mud and sludge poured downhill, wiping out Bento Rodrigues and flooding other towns.Residents of Bento Rodrigues said a deafening clap was the only hint they got that the sea of viscous, clay-red mud was about to hit.The mine that was the source of the dam burst belongs to Samarco, which assured residents that the sludge is not toxic.

Голова Національного антикорупційного бюро України Артем Ситник заявив про тиск з боку Генеральної прокуратури в контексті розслідування поїздки його дружини до Лондона. Як повідомляє НАБУ, Генеральна прокуратура вимагає від бюро матеріали, які стосуються цієї поїздки. Проте, згідно з Ситником, ця вимога є тиском на роботу НАБУ та спробою зупинити розслідування, яке ще не завершено.Нагадаємо, що дружина Артема Ситника подорожувала до Лондона разом з Миколою Злочевським, екс-власником банку "Приват", який перебуває в екстрадиційному ув'язненні у Великій Британії. Ситник стверджує, що НАБУ досі не має достатньої кількості доказів щодо можливої незаконності поїздки його дружини до Лондона разом з Злочевським.

Pakistan: Too Early to Declare Afghan Taliban 'Irreconcilable'Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi has said that it is too early to label the Afghan Taliban as "irreconcilable," amid efforts to bring peace to Afghanistan. Speaking to media on Wednesday, Qureshi stressed the need to engage with the Taliban and said that labeling them as "irreconcilable" would only "reduce space for peaceful dialogue." He also expressed concerns over the increasing violence in Afghanistan and called for a reduction in hostilities. The comments come as the Taliban has made significant territorial gains in Afghanistan amid the withdrawal of foreign troops. The group has also intensified its attacks in recent weeks, causing concerns about the fragile security situation in the country. The Afghan government has repeatedly called on the Taliban to join the peace process, but the group has so far refused to engage in talks. The international community has urged both sides to resume negotiations to end the decades-long conflict in Afghanistan.

Security is being increased in key countries around the world today as an international watch for more terrorist attacks is underway. The U.S. embassy in Riyadh said American consulates in the kingdom - and the embassy itself - would be closed beginning Wednesday due to information that a terrorist attack may be imminent.The heightened concerns come after another apparent terrorist attack in Turkey. At the same time investigations are ongoing into last week?s other deadly terrorist bombings in Morocco and Saudi Arabia. VOA-TV?s Chris Simkins has more.The latest bombing was at a cafe in Ankara located in one of the busiest sections of the capital. Turkish police say the apparent suicide attacker, a woman, was killed and another person was injured.There was no immediate claim of responsibility. In the past, Turkey's extreme-leftist groups and separatist Kurdish rebels have carried out suicide attacks on civilian targets.The Turkey bombing is the latest in a string of terrorist attacks that have left a trail of death and destruction in Saudi Arabia and Morocco. So far more than 75 people have died and hundreds of others have been injured in the wave of attacks.In Casablanca, Moroccan authorities have rounded up at least 30 suspects in connection with a series of bombings. Police say they are interrogating two men in connecting with Friday?s attack. Intelligence officials tell the American television network ABC News that a number of the attackers, who were Moroccans, trained in al-Qaida training camps in Afghanistan.MOHAMMED BENAISSA, MOROCCAN FOREIGN MINISTER ?

The U.N. Humanitarian coordinator in Pakistan says the crisis for hundreds of thousands of displaced people who have returned to homes they fled in the Swat Valley and other tribal areas is not over. He says their needs as well as those of the population who remained in the area during fighting between the Pakistani government and Taliban militants continue to be acute. By June, nearly three million people had fled from the fighting in the tribal areas bordering Afghanistan. The United Nations reports more than 1.6 million of the displaced have now returned to the homes they fled in the Swat Valley and other areas the government considers safe. But, the U.N. Humanitarian Coordinator in Pakistan, Martin Mogwanja, says the crisis is far from over. He says military operations are continuing longer than expected. He says the sudden upsurges of fighting between Pakistani government troops and militant Taliban in different areas of return is prompting tens of thousands of people to once again flee their homes. He says this is causing further military operations and further displacement. "So, this kind of cyclical problem of displacement is extremely unsettling for the population and limits the possibility for the population to reinvest in economic activities such as agriculture, commerce and so on and so forth," he said.

Praha - Mráz v posledních dnech neúprosně způsobuje problémy obyvatelům celé České republiky. V noci ze čtvrtka na pátek 22. ledna dosáhla teplota v Pardubicích hodnoty -14,7 °C, což je nový rekord zimní sezóny. Podle meteorologů však není tento mráz neobvyklý pro tuto dobu roku a nelze vyloučit, že se ještě v následujících dnech teploty ještě sníží. V případě venkovní aktivity je tedy nutné být obezřetný a dodržovat zásady zimního oblékání a ochrany před chladem. V některých částech země navíc hrozí i další nebezpečí, jako jsou náledí, větrem způsobené škody a sněhové zácpy. Odborníci proto radí, aby se lidé připravili na možné komplikace a v případě nutnosti využili pomoc a rady hasičů a dalších záchranářů.

Areas of Indonesia devastated by the Indian Ocean Tsunami are marking the third anniversary of one of the worst natural disasters in modern history. As the effort to build housing and roads wraps up, reconstruction officials say they are now focusing on helping tsunami-stricken areas become self-sufficient. As Chad Bouchard reports from Jakarta, challenges remain in preparing local leaders to run rebuilt communities.More than 160,000 people died or disappeared in northern Sumatra on December 26, 2004, when towering waves battered the coast.Tens of thousands more perished in a dozen countries surrounding the Indian Ocean.With the help of international donors and aid organizations, Indonesia has built more than 100,000 houses to replace those destroyed in the disaster.That puts housing reconstruction three months ahead of schedule. Teams are on target to finish 20,000 more by next April.Other new construction includes 2,000 kilometers of roads and about 800 schools.Nia Sarinastiti of the Multi Donor Fund, which the World Bank set up to handle international tsunami aid, says her organization now focuses on handing this new infrastructure over to local governments."
Las elecciones presidenciales de Estados Unidos siempre han tenido un profundo impacto en las relaciones entre España y Estados Unidos, debido a la importancia económica y militar de ambas naciones.

A life-saving vaccination program targeting diphtheria in Yemen is still stalled despite a commitment by the U.N.'s child agency to make it possible, the U.N. children's agency said Thursday.In a statement, Save the Children said its team was planning to arrive in the country next month to set up a clinic to treat around 300 children for the disease.But the WHO said "it's not going to be quick" to make the process happen."There are political tensions in the country, so even as we move forward with the vaccinations, it's not going to be quick," said Dr. John Stohler, who is the global head of the program.The U.N. has said it needs to ramp up operations in the world's poorest country to stop one of the world's deadliest epidemics, one that killed over 1 million people during the 2011-2012 pandemic.Save the Children has said the next steps would be to buy equipment and organize personnel in order to make the vaccinations available to every child, regardless of family status.

U.S. Central Command chief Major General James McConville says the Iranian-backed Iraqi fighters could be confused by the recent U.S.-Iraqi debate over who will control the disputed areas of Baghdad."We're working together to make sure our coalition partners, and the Iraqi people, and the international community understand that we are going to have a joint response in Iraq," McConville told reporters on Thursday.The top U.S. military official said the current military debate does not affect U.S. strategic decisions regarding U.S. involvement in the conflict."The military decisions that we make in terms of what we are going to do in Iraq or how we have been involved there is for sure strategic decisions," he said.On Monday, senior U.S. officials said the U.S. may target Iranian-backed militias with American airstrikes in Iraq in response to an Iraqi request for military help against the Islamic State group (IS) militants in the country's east.In response to that demand, Iraqi lawmakers last month passed a resolution calling on the U.S. government to deploy a military force against the IS militants.The Iraqi parliament approved the resolution that demanded the country's leaders to establish a "decentralized" Iraqi authority to control the disputed areas."Our concern is that our coalition partners and the Iraqi government may confuse that with us sending ground troops," McConville said."We want to see political reconciliation in Iraq and that's something that we are very focused on, not on using force," he added.

Publicado em: 18/11/2014 - 16:25O resultado de um relatório realizado em conjunto por cinco ONGs francesas é taxativo: o governo francês continua a sua política de expulsão de estrangeiros em situação ilegal. No ano passado, houve uma alta de 15% nesses processos em relação a 2012, diz o estudo divulgado nesta terça-feira (18).“A França prendeu e continua a prender pessoas estrangeiras, inclusive as mais vulneráveis”, diz trecho do relatório. As ONGs fizeram essa constatação a partir da visita a centros de retenção administrativa para onde são encaminhados os imigrantes em situação irregular. No ano passado, 45 mil pessoas ficaram detidas, incluindo 3.097 crianças. Em média, elas passaram 11 dias “privadas de liberdade”, revela o relatório.“Prender para expulsar”. Essa é a política do governo, na avaliação das associações. Mas, muitas vezes, essas expulsões significam apenas empurrar o problema para um país vizinho. “60% das expulsões foram realizadas tendo como destino um membro da União Europeia”, diz David Rohi, da ONG Cimade. "Essa máquina de expulsão tornou-se maluca e inadaptada. Essa política absurda não vai regular os fluxos migratórios”.A situação das crianças é outro problema.

Zambian President Levy Mwanawasa says he is ready to pardon former president Frederick Chiluba, if Mr. Chiluba returns any assets he?s taken from the country.The former president has been accused of corruption, and parliament recently voted to lift his immunity from prosecution. But Zambia?s high court has put parliament?s decision on hold until it rules on whether it is legal. That ruling is expected on July 29th.Richard Sakala, the former special assistant to Mr. Chiluba, says the former president will not comment on the pardon offer ?because of the legal implications?because the matters are likely to be in court at some point.? Mr. Sakala says the issue of immunity is currently before the High Court.He says Mr. Chiluba won?t comment because ?commenting on cases that are before the courts is an offense itself. One can be cited for contempt.? He says he does not know why President Mwanawasa is talking about the case. He says, ?President Mwanawasa is a lawyer, so maybe he knows better than some of us laymen. But commenting on it would be breaking the law.? He adds that the law says a former president ?cannot be taken to court for any civil or criminal matters.?

Об этом ТАСС сообщили в пресс-службе Выборгского района. “На улице Байкальской выявлено взрывное устройство, которое является боеприпасом времен Великой Отечественной войны. В качестве мер предосторожности в радиусе до ста метров от места обнаружения боеприпаса временно закрыта для движения автомобильной и пешеходной дорожки", - сообщили в пресс-службе.

在2012年4月17日，《互动平台》（DW）播出了一节关于互动平台的独特篇幅。在篇幅中，DW对互动平台进行了深入的介绍，并向观众介绍了一些互动平台的例子，如社交网络、在线聊天、即时通讯等。DW指出，这些平台不仅提供了人与人之间的交流方式，还为人们提供了很多有趣的互动体验。它们不仅在互联网上流行，还可以在移动设备上使用。DW也介绍了一些互动平台的安全问题，呼吁用户注意保护自己的隐私。这一篇幅既讲究了互动平台的优点，也提醒观众在使用这些平台时需要谨慎。

Afghan religious leaders on Thursday strongly refuted pro-Taliban remarks by a top Pakistani religious and political leader, classifying them as an "intelligence spin."In response to recent remarks by Maulana Fazl-ur-Rahman, leader of Pakistani's Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam (JUI-F), a conservative religious party accused of maintaining links with various militant groups, the Islamic Scholars Council of Afghanistan called for an Islamic conference to be held in Kabul to debate the religious legitimacy of the Taliban insurgency in Afghanistan."Genuine and pious clerics from Pakistan, along with renowned Islamic scholars from the Muslim world, should convene for a religious debate with Afghan religious scholars to assess the situation in Afghanistan, based on the book of Allah [Quran] and teachings of the Prophet [Muhammad]," the Afghan clerics council said.The statement added that the Pakistani cleric has attempted to legitimize the "inhumane and heinous" actions of militants who have targeted schools, hospitals and mosques throughout the country in their bloody insurgency, killing tens of thousands of innocent Afghan civilians over the last decade.FILE - U.S. soldiers monitor battlefield conditions at a joint U.S.-Afghan command center in Ghazni province, west of Kabul, Afghanistan, June 21, 2007.The JUI-F leader last week linked the Afghan Taliban's insurgency to the presence of U.S. and NATO forces in Afghanistan, in an effort to justify the Taliban's continued violence in the country.Rahman said peace in Afghanistan would not be achieved as long as foreign troops were in the country."

El gerente de la campaña presidencial de Juan Manuel Santos, sucedió la controversia que causaron las revelaciones de la firma constructora brasileña Odebrecht. En declaraciones a la prensa, el gerente reconoció que Odebrecht financió la campaña electoral del entonces candidato a la Presidencia de Colombia en el año 2010. "Los fondos fueron entregados a la campaña, y la verdad es que el financiamiento recibido no superaba los límites establecidos por la ley", declaró el gerente. Añadió que la campaña se abocó a cumplir con todos los requerimientos legales y que esta contribución, aunque no fue reportada oficialmente, se ajustó a los límites legales.Al mismo tiempo, el gerente señaló que, contrario a los rumores, no recibieron recursos de la empresa después de que Santos asumiera el cargo presidencial. El tema sigue siendo investigado por los organismos correspondientes y está pendiente de los informes que arrojen las entidades.

Russia's top diplomat on Friday called the Ecumenical Patriarchate's decision to recognize the Ukrainian Orthodox Church's independence from Moscow a Washington-backed "provocation," from which he vowed to protect "the faithful" in Ukraine if the schism sparks violence.On Thursday, Patriarch Bartholomew of Constantinople, the Istanbul-based head of global Orthodox Christianity, recognized Ukrainian churches as independent from the Russian Orthodox Church, ending the Moscow Patriarchy's 332-year oversight of Ukrainian parishes.The move has immediately restored Ecumenical Patriarchate jurisdiction over all Orthodox faithful in Ukraine, granting the Ukrainian Orthodox Church the right to autocephaly — the ecclesiastical term for self-governance. Under this decree, leaders of Ukraine's Orthodox Christian community will be able to form an independently administrated Ukrainian Orthodox Church.Orthodox pilgrims from Ukraine react after a statement following the Synod meeting at the Ecumenical Orthodox Patriarchate in Istanbul, Turkey, Oct. 11, 2018.Calling the decision "a provocation by Patriarch Bartholomew of Constantinople, undertaken with direct public support from Washington," Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov described the move as part of a conspiracy in violation of internationally recognized laws."

A special United Nations investigator says thousands of Afghans are being forcibly evicted from their homes by warlords, politicians and land speculators. He says the victims are rarely compensated. The report was submitted to the U.N. Human Rights Commission, which is holding its annual six-week session in Geneva.U.N. human rights expert Miloon Kothari says land-grabbing goes on throughout Afghanistan. He says forced evictions sometimes are accompanied by violence, and people often are thrown out of their homes, without prior warning.When he visited Afghanistan last year, he says, he tried to intervene in a case of forced evictions in the capital, Kabul. He says 100 armed police officers, accompanied by bulldozers and trucks, destroyed the homes of around 30 families. He says the people received no warning that their houses were to be demolished."We also found that the evictions were being carried out, so that land would be cleared for ministers to build houses for themselves," said Mr. Kothari. "We also found evidence that ministers, including the defense minister and the education minister, had not only received land, but also gained from speculating on the land."Mr. Kothari says, in some cases, the ministers had bought plots of land for as little as $4,000, and subsequently sold them for about $100,000.Following this incident, Mr. Kothari says, Afghan President Hamid Karzai set up an independent investigative commission to look into the issue of forced evictions.

Několik týdnů po zahájení vyšetřování, který přednostně mělo dojít k různým způsobům, ale ještě před touto dobou, vláda se odhodlala dohodnout s ministrem financí o řízení vyšetřování, nenašla z něj klíč k tomu, aby vyšetřování přispělo k pozornosti a ukázala, jak se pro všechny dlouhé pěti let minulé vlády zabývaly členské židy na mezinárodních scénách jako politická kampaň.Přesto před zahájením vyšetřování počítal jistě, že se ministr financí zastaví, zase to přímo dělá. Dává vytlačené zprávy z minulého týdne a z výsledku vyšetřování samotné neví, k čemu je dnes. A ještě nebylo konečně zahájeno.Ale není nikdo nad něj, připouští na svém schůzce konkrétní věci s týmem svého ministerstva vnitra. Pochopení nadpřirozeného vyšetřování se nepohnulo.

President Donald Trump said Wednesday that most Americans are willing to go back to work as soon as possible despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. “People want to get back to work. They’re looking for jobs, they’re looking for places to make money,” Trump said, citing statistics on recent job growth. “This is a great opportunity for America. We have to be smart, but we have to take advantage of it.” Trump also added that he is confident in the response of his administration. “We’ve done a lot of things, we’ve done them quickly, we’ve done them effectively, and we’re going to continue to do that.” As coronavirus cases continue to rise in the United States and elsewhere, Trump has stressed repeatedly that the U.S. has the capability to contain the outbreak, while keeping the economy running. “We’re going to handle it, and we’re going to handle it in a very, very efficient way,” he added.

El Presidente Rafael Correa se refirió este lunes al tema de la transferencia de los aviones de la Fuerza Aérea Ecuatoriana (FAE) al Ministerio de Defensa. Durante su discurso en televisión, el mandatario aseguró que el traspaso se debe a necesidades militares y busca acentuar el rol de la defensa nacional. Correa destacó que el país tiene la obligación de protegerse, por lo que se ha fortalecido la FAE con un nuevo nivel de dotación de equipo de guerra, que incluye los aviones mencionados. Añadió que los fondos asignados para estos equipos se han destinado con transparencia y legalidad.El presidente señaló que el traspaso de los aviones no está relacionado con los planes de regreso del expresidente Abdalá Bucaram, quien fue exiliado hace 18 años, sino que es una decisión por razones de seguridad nacional. Finalmente, exhortó a la población a respaldar estas medidas a través de una discusión profunda y racional.

Following the fatal crash of Bhoja Air's flight B4-213 in April 2012, the owner of the airline has been banned from leaving Pakistan. Farooq Bhoja, the owner, was reportedly attempting to travel to Dubai when he was stopped at Islamabad International Airport. The ban was issued by the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) after a case was registered against Bhoja Air and its executives. The case accuses them of causing death by negligence, among other charges. The crash of Bhoja Air's Boeing 737-236 killed all 121 passengers and crew members on board. The plane was flying from Karachi to Islamabad when it crashed near the capital's airport. The incident was one of the deadliest aviation accidents in Pakistan's history. The investigation into the crash has been ongoing for over eight years. In 2013, a report by the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) blamed the crash on a combination of technical and human factors. The report cited a lack of proper maintenance of the aircraft and a decision to attempt a landing in poor weather conditions as contributing factors. Bhoja Air was grounded by the CAA after the crash, and its license was later revoked. The airline had been operating domestic flights in Pakistan since 1993. The ban on Farooq Bhoja leaving Pakistan is seen as a positive step by many who believe the airline and its executives should be held accountable for the crash. It remains to be seen what further action will be taken in the ongoing investigation.

In a recent meeting, the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) acknowledged that the humanitarian situation in Iraq remains a major challenge. Despite progress made in the country's security and political spheres, the council members recognized that many Iraqis still struggle to access basic necessities like food, water, and healthcare.The UNSC report highlighted the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, economic instability, and displacement caused by conflicts and violence. It noted that these factors have contributed to the overall decline of living conditions in the country. Furthermore, the report emphasized that women, children, and other vulnerable groups are disproportionately affected by the humanitarian crisis.In response to the situation, the UNSC called on the Iraqi government and international community to address the immediate needs of the affected population. The council urged increased efforts to provide humanitarian aid and access to essential services. It also stressed the importance of ensuring protection and support for civilians affected by violence and displacement.The UNSC report underscored the need for long-term solutions to the humanitarian crisis in Iraq. It called for greater investment in infrastructure, education, and employment opportunities, as well as increased efforts to promote social cohesion and reconciliation. The council emphasized that sustained international support is critical to achieving lasting stability and addressing the root causes of the crisis.In conclusion, the UNSC report emphasized that the humanitarian situation in Iraq remains a major challenge that requires urgent attention and concerted efforts by all stakeholders. It urged the international community to continue to support the Iraqi government and its people in their efforts to overcome the crisis and build a peaceful and prosperous future.

Veröffentlicht am 08.03.2013 | Lesedauer: 2 MinutenLegionellen können immer dann gefährlich werden, wenn Menschen sie über Dampf aufnehmen, also etwa in der Dusche. Denn dann können sie die Lunge angreifenEin viertel Jahr lang nicht duschen dürfen: Was die Bewohner eines Neu-Ulmer Hochhauses durchmachen, könnte bald immer mehr Deutsche treffen. Grund sind strengere Untersuchungen des Trinkwassers.Wegen Legionellen im Trinkwassersystem dürfen etwa 500 Bewohner eines Hochhauses im schwäbischen Neu-Ulm seit drei Monaten nicht mehr duschen. Hintergrund ist eine Änderung der Vorschriften, wonach in Wohnblocks die Qualität des Trinkwasser kontrolliert werden muss. Experten rechnen deshalb künftig mit einer deutlichen Zunahme solcher Duschverbote.Bei einer Prüfung der Wasserleitung sei eine extrem hohe Konzentration der Keime festgestellt worden, sagte der Leiter des Gesundheitsdienstes im Landratsamt, Martin Küfer.

El govern xinès ha anunciat noves restriccions i regulacions en el món dels videojocs en línia, exigint que els jocs segueixin les lleis i normes de la vida real. Aquesta decisió té l'objectiu de protegir la salut mental i física dels ciutadans, especialment els menors, i evitar la promoció de continguts violents, sexuals i no ètics.Les noves mesures, que han estat introduïdes pel Ministeri de Cultura i Turisme de la Xina, estableixen que els videojocs en línia han d'implementar un sistema d'identificació real, que permeti verificar l'edat i la identitat dels jugadors.

The newly elected House Majority Leader, Rep. Steny Hoyer (D-Md.), has promised to tackle the "immigration challenges" that the United States is currently facing. In a statement released on Thursday, Hoyer emphasized that comprehensive immigration reform is necessary to ensure that America remains a welcoming and inclusive society.Hoyer, who is set to take over as House Majority Leader in January 2019, pledged to work with both Democrats and Republicans to find a bipartisan solution to the country's immigration problems. He stated that he would prioritize legislation that provides a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants who have been living and working in the U.S. for years."I believe that we must find a way to secure our borders while also ensuring that we don't turn our backs on the millions of hardworking immigrants who have contributed so much to our nation," Hoyer said. "We need a sensible, compassionate, and fair approach to immigration that reflects our values as a country."The issue of immigration has become a contentious and polarizing topic in recent years, with President Donald Trump and his administration taking a hard-line stance on illegal immigration. Hoyer's vow to address the issue is likely to face opposition from conservatives who believe in stricter enforcement of immigration laws.Despite the challenges ahead, Hoyer remains optimistic that progress can be made on immigration reform. "I'm confident that by working together, we can achieve a solution that is fair, just, and beneficial to all Americans," he said.

Роскомнадзор вынес предупреждение четырем российским интернет-изданиям из-за материалов о новосибирском художнике Артеме Лоскутове, оштрафованном за распространение футболок со стилизованным под икону изображением в поддержку панк-группы Pussy Riot.Предупреждение было вынесено сайтам "Грани.Ру", "Обещания. Ru", "Сибкрай.ru" и "Полит.ру". В их публикациях Роскомнадзор увидел "возбуждение религиозной розни".При этом другим изданиям, писавшим о штрафе Лоскутову, предупреждений вынесено не было.Лоскутов был оштрафован за оскорбление религиозных чувств 1 февраля 2013 года, но впоследствии обжаловал это решение.

HYDRO, OKLA. - It's apt that a maze cut into an Oklahoma cornfield featuring the likeness of a former NASA astronaut can be seen from space - and has been photographed by a satellite orbiting Earth.The image of Oklahoma-born Thomas P. Stafford is cut into a 10-acre field at P Bar Farms in Hydro, about 60 miles (100 kilometers) west of Oklahoma City. The maze was created in partnership with the Stafford Air and Space Museum, named for the astronaut, in nearby Weatherford. A satellite photographed the tribute from its orbit 400 miles (650 kilometers) away. The 88-year-old Stafford is a Weatherford native whose space missions included commanding the Apollo flight that linked with a Soviet spacecraft in 1975.

Two plane parts that washed up on the coast of Australia are now being examined for potential links to Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, which went missing in March 2014. The parts were found in 2016 and 2017 and have been identified as being from a Boeing 777, the same type of aircraft as MH370. The Australian Transport Safety Bureau is leading the investigation and has sent the parts to experts in France for further analysis. This latest development is part of the ongoing search for the missing plane, which disappeared with 239 people on board en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing.

Генеральне консульство України у Мілані звернулося до суду Падуї із клопотанням про надання інформації щодо затримання вояка Нацгвардії Віталія Марківа.Українські дипломати також просять дозволити їм відвідати затриманого українця."Справа про затримання громадянина В.

In a bizarre turn of events, famed horror movie director Wes Craven has filed a lawsuit against his neighbor, comedian Pauly Shore. According to the lawsuit, Craven alleges that Shore has been causing significant disturbances that have interfered with the director's work and well-being.The lawsuit, filed in Los Angeles County Superior Court, accuses Shore of various nuisances, including loud and raucous parties, the constant presence of construction crews, and disruptions caused by Shore's pet menagerie. U.N. envoy for Syria Geir Pedersen, who was named this month to head U.N. Syria peace efforts, warned the Security Council on Tuesday that he will be taking on an "impossible mission," where decades of bitter conflict have failed to end the fighting.Pedersen told the Security Council that he would start his job on Jan. 7 after a year and a half as the U.N. special envoy for Yemen. He succeeds Staffan de Mistura, who announced his resignation in November."Syria is a country broken into pieces, with a depth of polarization and a level of international distrust that makes it an impossible mission," Pedersen told the 15-member council. "This is not the moment to walk away."With the country in its eighth year of conflict, Pedersen said he would try to build on de Mistura's efforts to advance a political solution to the conflict that has killed hundreds of thousands and displaced millions."My job will be to navigate a path to a political solution, even as I realize there is no such thing as'mission impossible,'" he said.Pedersen said he would focus on five key areas — constitutional reform, elections, governance, the fight against terrorism and cross-border assistance, which is currently not allowed without Security Council authorization.U.N. Syria envoy de Mistura told the council he felt he was leaving on a "high note" after a "considerably longer" peace process than he first envisaged."I am leaving behind a Syria that is still on the battlefield, even if the intensity of the fighting is far below what it used to be. I am leaving behind a Syria with some hope, even if the hope is much lower than it was," he said.
